title: Link
excerpt: The Link component is used for clickable text that navigates the user to another page or resource. It typically displays as underlined text with a distinct color, and can be customized with various props such as color, size, and so on

body.raw:
## Props ### size - Type: string - Default: `md` - Options: `2xs` | `xs` | `sm` | `md` | `lg` | `xl` | `2xl` The size prop controls the size of the text. The following values are valid: Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Link.tsx" Some text. Some text. Some text. Some text. Some text. Some text. ``` ### weight The weight prop controls the weight (boldness) of the text. The following values are valid: Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Link.tsx" Some text. Some text. Some text. Some text. Some text. ``` Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Link.tsx" Some important text. ``` ### weight:`thin` |`extra-light` |`light` |`normal` |`medium` |`bold` |`extra-bold` The truncate prop with the value of "multiline" will truncate the text if it exceeds the specified numberLine prop value and will display an ellipsis at the end of the last visible line. On the other hand, if the truncate prop value is "singleline", it will truncate the text to fit within a single line and display an ellipsis at the end of the truncated text. truncate (optional): Determines whether the text should be truncated and how it should be truncated. If the value is "singleline", the text will be truncated to fit within a single line and display an ellipsis at the end of the truncated text. If the value is "multiline", the text will be truncated if it exceeds the specified numberLine prop value and display an ellipsis at the end of the last visible line. Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Link.tsx" export function LinkTrucates() { return (

It can take one of the following values: - start: The text is aligned to the left (default). - center: The text is centered horizontally. - end: The text is aligned to the right. Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Link.tsx" export function LinkAligns() { return (

The available options are: red, brown, purple, secondary, green, orange, primary, and surfacecece. The contrast prop sets the contrast level between the text and the background color. When contrast is set to "high", the text has a higher contrast with the background, making it easier to read, while when contrast is set to "low", the text has lower contrast with the background, which can make it more difficult to read the default is `high`. Example: ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Link.tsx" export function LinkColors() { return (

This prop accepts four different values: "normal", "sm", "md", and "lg" Example ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Link.tsx" This text has a normal line height. This text has a small line height. This text has a medium line height. This text has a large line height. ``` By using the leading prop, you can easily adjust the line height of your text to create a more visually appealing design. ### dir For RTL language Support "dir": This prop sets the direction of the text within the component. It accepts the values "rtl" for right-to-left direction or "ltr" for left-to-right direction. This prop is useful when displaying text in languages that are read from right to left, such as Arabic or Hebrew. ```tsx showLineNumbers title="Link.tsx" export function LinkRTL() { return (
مُرَاكُش اموراكوش، «أرض الله») تسمى أيضًا بالمدينة الحمراء وعاصمة النخيل، هي ثالث أكبر مدينة في المملكة المغربية من ناحية عدد السكان. وهي عاصمة جهة مراكش آسفي. تقع مراكش على بعد 580 كم (360 ميل) جنوب شرق طنجة، 327 كم (203 ميل) جنوب شرق العاصمة المغربية الرباط، 239 كم (149 ميل) جنوب شرق الدار البيضاء، و 246 كم (153 ميل) شمال شرق أكادير. ללמוד לקוד זה אחד הדברים הכי טובים שאני עושה כל חיי ކޯޑް ކުރަން ދަސްކުރުމަކީ އަހަރެންގެ މުޅި އުމުރުގައި ވެސް ކުރި އެންމެ ރަނގަޅު ކަމެކެވެ
) } ``` ## Use Case The Link component can be used to display text in various sizes and weights. ## Implementation details The Link component is implemented using JSX and styled with CSS. ## Accessibility The Link component uses semantic HTML elements and provides an aria-label attribute when necessary to ensure accessibility. ## TypeScript Support The Link component has full TypeScript support. ## Troubleshooting If the text is not displaying as expected, make sure that the correct props are being used and that any necessary styles are applied. ## Conclusion The Link component is a versatile component that can be used to display text in various sizes and weights with full accessibility and TypeScript support.
